categories.title: Recent Updates and Changes in ElizaOS

content.text: The ElizaOS project has seen several updates and changes recently. One of the updates involves the feature update to 'tee', which is part of a pull request aimed at improving existing features and adding new functionality. The update is considered low risk and does not require changes to the project documentation.

Another significant change is the refactoring of the string literal 'http://localhost' to use the 'SERVER_URL' environment variable in the client. This change is categorized as a feature and is designed to facilitate running Eliza on different setups, such as a home lab. The change is low risk and does not necessitate documentation updates.
Additionally, there has been a synchronization of the main Eliza repository with Jobsy, ensuring that the latest updates and features are aligned across both projects.

categories.title: Issues with Eliza Agent Deployment and Client Display

content.text: A user is experiencing a 'No Ports found' error when deploying a Twitter Eliza agent on Render, despite it working perfectly on localhost. Attempts to resolve the issue by changing environment variables and updating the server port configuration have been unsuccessful. The user is seeking help or alternatives for deployment on Render.

Another user reports that after following installation instructions, the Eliza client starts but only displays a blank page with errors in the console. The errors include a syntax error related to a missing export in 'react-router.js' and network connection issues. The expected behavior is for the client to start and display chat with the agent.

categories.title: Official Announcements on v2 Launch and Contract Addresses

content.text: v2 has officially arrived. It's been a long time in the making.
PSA: These are the only official contract addresses. No new tokens.

categories.title: Updates on Onboarding System and ElizaOS v2 Launch

content.text: The onboarding system has been improved, allowing agents to onboard in their own voice and access necessary information. New tasks for handling follow-ups have been added.
ElizaOS v2 has been officially launched. The Phase 1 Distribution is open to $ai16z holders and members of the ai16z ecosystem. An updated roadmap will be released soon.
A public service announcement clarifies that there are no new tokens and advises ignoring @shawmakesmagic until the account is recovered and the situation is assessed.
